result.execSummary:
The defendant Damen C. Small was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Damen C. Small is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Damen C. Small was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Damen C. Small was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Defendant has 53 days credit if probation revoked.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent including Anger Managment and Domestic Abuse.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UA's.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damen C. Small in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Damen C. Small in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to revoke DPA.  No objection to revoking DPA.  P&P will not revoke current probation.  Court revokes DPA.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:
$443.00 costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
6 mos. in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Forthwith
94 days credit
Paperwork handed in court.
Motion hearing on September 8, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Damen C. Small in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Damen C. Small in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 2:
24 months Probation
15 days SCJ, w/work release.  Commence forthwith.
53 days credit if probation revoked
Absolute Sobriety
No entry into entities/business' that primary sale is alcohol or drug paraphernalia
Submit Random UAs
Obtain full time employment/schooling
Undergo any counseling per agent include Anger Management & Domestic Abuse.
AODA & treatment
$543.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Count 3:
DISMISSED

Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Damen C. Small in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Damen C. Small in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend count 1 to 940.19(1) - misd. battery.    NCP entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. withholds adj. of guilt. Deferred Prosecution Ordered 24 mos. on Ct. 1; File agreement within 30 days.  Review scheduled for January 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damen C. Small in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Damen C. Small in custody.  John Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klopp addresses motion.  Requesting reducing the cash bond.  Currently unemployed.  Request smaller cash bond of $100 or signature bond.  Address is current.  Request lifting the no contact.  State objects to motion to modify bond.  14CT10 another pending matter in Marquette County.  Missed court dates in Marquette Co.  State goes through charges filed and allegations in complaint.  Attorney Klopp argues bond modification further.  Court denies motion to modify bond.
Motion hearing on October 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Return date on December 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Damen C. Small in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Damen C. Small in custody.  John Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klopp advises court just appointed and waiving time limits today.  Reset for PTC/RD.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Damen C. Small appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Tom Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $500.00Cash bond.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $300.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & controlled substances; No contact w/A.S. or her mother L.K. or their residences.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 10:15 am.
